trans-unit.source: Android and Samsung KNOX policy settings | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Android and Samsung KNOX policy settings | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Create policies that control settings and features on Android devices that you manage with Intune.
trans-unit.target: Create policies that control settings and features on Android devices that you manage with Intune.

trans-unit.source: Android and Samsung KNOX policy settings in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Android and Samsung KNOX policy settings in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Intune supplies a range of built-in general settings that you can configure on Android devices.
trans-unit.target: Intune supplies a range of built-in general settings that you can configure on Android devices.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you can specify Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier (OMA-URI) values to create custom settings that are not available from Intune.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you can specify Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier (OMA-URI) values to create custom settings that are not available from Intune.

trans-unit.source: Use the Intune **Android general configuration policy** to configure settings for:
trans-unit.target: Use the Intune **Android general configuration policy** to configure settings for:

trans-unit.source: **Mobile device security settings** - Choose from a list of predefined settings that let you control a range of features and functionality on the device.
trans-unit.target: **Mobile device security settings** - Choose from a list of predefined settings that let you control a range of features and functionality on the device.

trans-unit.source: **Kiosk mode** (for Samsung KNOX devices only) - Lock a device to allow only certain features to work.
trans-unit.target: **Kiosk mode** (for Samsung KNOX devices only) - Lock a device to allow only certain features to work.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can allow a device to run only one managed app that you specify, or you can disable the volume buttons on a device.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can allow a device to run only one managed app that you specify, or you can disable the volume buttons on a device.

trans-unit.source: These settings might be used for a demonstration model of a device or a device that is dedicated to performing only one function, such as a point-of-sale device.
trans-unit.target: These settings might be used for a demonstration model of a device or a device that is dedicated to performing only one function, such as a point-of-sale device.

trans-unit.source: **Compliant and noncompliant apps** - Specify a list of apps that are compliant or noncompliant in your company.
trans-unit.target: **Compliant and noncompliant apps** - Specify a list of apps that are compliant or noncompliant in your company.

trans-unit.source: On Android and iOS devices, the **Noncompliant Apps Report** can be used to view the compliance of apps that you specified in the list against the apps that users have installed.
trans-unit.target: On Android and iOS devices, the **Noncompliant Apps Report** can be used to view the compliance of apps that you specified in the list against the apps that users have installed.

trans-unit.source: The report can't actually block the installation of the app.
trans-unit.target: The report can't actually block the installation of the app.

trans-unit.source: You can configure terms and conditions for users to ensure that they acknowledge that all apps on their device, including personal apps, will be evaluated, and that noncompliant apps will either be blocked or reported as noncompliant.
trans-unit.target: You can configure terms and conditions for users to ensure that they acknowledge that all apps on their device, including personal apps, will be evaluated, and that noncompliant apps will either be blocked or reported as noncompliant.

trans-unit.source: Users must accept these terms and conditions before they can enroll their device and use the company portal to get apps.
trans-unit.target: Users must accept these terms and conditions before they can enroll their device and use the company portal to get apps.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using terms and conditions, see [Terms and condition policy settings in Microsoft Intune](terms-and-condition-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about using terms and conditions, see [Terms and condition policy settings in Microsoft Intune](terms-and-condition-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: If the setting you are looking for does not appear in this topic, you might be able to create it by using an Android custom policy that lets you use OMA-URI settings to control the device.
trans-unit.target: If the setting you are looking for does not appear in this topic, you might be able to create it by using an Android custom policy that lets you use OMA-URI settings to control the device.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to [Custom policy settings](#custom-policy-settings) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to [Custom policy settings](#custom-policy-settings) later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Require a password to unlock mobile devices
trans-unit.target: Require a password to unlock mobile devices

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether to require a password on supported devices.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether to require a password on supported devices.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the minimum length of the password.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the minimum length of the password.

trans-unit.source: Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped
trans-unit.target: Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped.

trans-unit.source: Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off
trans-unit.target: Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of minutes of inactivity before the device automatically locks.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of minutes of inactivity before the device automatically locks.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of days before a password must be changed.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of days before a password must be changed.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of previously used passwords to remember.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of previously used passwords to remember.

trans-unit.source: **Remember password history** - **Prevent reuse of previous passwords**
trans-unit.target: **Remember password history** - **Prevent reuse of previous passwords**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the password complexity level that's required and whether biometric devices can be used.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the password complexity level that's required and whether biometric devices can be used.

trans-unit.source: Allows the use of a fingerprint to unlock the device.
trans-unit.target: Allows the use of a fingerprint to unlock the device.

trans-unit.source: Allow Smart Lock and other trust agents
trans-unit.target: Allow Smart Lock and other trust agents

trans-unit.source: Lets you control the Smart Lock feature on compatible Android devices.
trans-unit.target: Lets you control the Smart Lock feature on compatible Android devices.

trans-unit.source: This phone capability, sometimes known as a trust agent, lets you disable or bypass the device lock screen password if the device is in a trusted location (for example, when it's connected to a specific Bluetooth device, or when it's close to an NFC tag.) You can use this setting to prevent users from configuring Smart Lock.
trans-unit.target: This phone capability, sometimes known as a trust agent, lets you disable or bypass the device lock screen password if the device is in a trusted location (for example, when it's connected to a specific Bluetooth device, or when it's close to an NFC tag.) You can use this setting to prevent users from configuring Smart Lock.

trans-unit.source: Requires that files on the mobile device are encrypted.
trans-unit.target: Requires that files on the mobile device are encrypted.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the device storage card must be encrypted.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the device storage card must be encrypted.

trans-unit.source: Lets the user capture the screen contents as an image.
trans-unit.target: Lets the user capture the screen contents as an image.

trans-unit.source: Allows the device to submit diagnostic information to Google.
trans-unit.target: Allows the device to submit diagnostic information to Google.

trans-unit.source: Allows the user to perform a factory reset on the device.
trans-unit.target: Allows the user to perform a factory reset on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allows the use of Google backup.
trans-unit.target: Allows the use of Google backup.

trans-unit.source: Allows Google account settings to be automatically synchronized.
trans-unit.target: Allows Google account settings to be automatically synchronized.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the device's default web browser can be used.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the device's default web browser can be used.

trans-unit.source: Allows the autofill function of the web browser to be used.
trans-unit.target: Allows the autofill function of the web browser to be used.

trans-unit.source: Allows the use of the pop-up blocker in the web browser.
trans-unit.target: Allows the use of the pop-up blocker in the web browser.

trans-unit.source: Allows the device web browser to use cookies.
trans-unit.target: Allows the device web browser to use cookies.

trans-unit.source: Allows the device web browser to use active scripting.
trans-unit.target: Allows the device web browser to use active scripting.

trans-unit.source: Allows the user to access the Google Play store on the device.
trans-unit.target: Allows the user to access the Google Play store on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allows the use of the device camera.
trans-unit.target: Allows the use of the device camera.

trans-unit.source: Allows the device to use removable storage, like an SD card.
trans-unit.target: Allows the device to use removable storage, like an SD card.

trans-unit.source: Allows the use of the Wi-Fi capabilities of the device.
trans-unit.target: Allows the use of the Wi-Fi capabilities of the device.

trans-unit.source: Allows the use of Wi-Fi tethering on the device.
trans-unit.target: Allows the use of Wi-Fi tethering on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allows the device to utilize location information.
trans-unit.target: Allows the device to utilize location information.

trans-unit.source: Allows operations that use near field communication if the device supports it.
trans-unit.target: Allows operations that use near field communication if the device supports it.

trans-unit.source: Allows the use of Bluetooth on the device.
trans-unit.target: Allows the use of Bluetooth on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allows the user to power off the device.
trans-unit.target: Allows the user to power off the device.

trans-unit.source: If this setting is disabled, the setting **Number of repeated sign in failures to allow before the device is wiped** for Samsung KNOX devices does not function.
trans-unit.target: If this setting is disabled, the setting **Number of repeated sign in failures to allow before the device is wiped** for Samsung KNOX devices does not function.

trans-unit.source: Allows voice roaming when the device is on a cellular network.
trans-unit.target: Allows voice roaming when the device is on a cellular network.

trans-unit.source: Allows data roaming when the device is on a cellular network.
trans-unit.target: Allows data roaming when the device is on a cellular network.

trans-unit.source: Allows the use of SMS and MMS messaging on the device.
trans-unit.target: Allows the use of SMS and MMS messaging on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allows the use of voice assistant software on the device.
trans-unit.target: Allows the use of voice assistant software on the device.

trans-unit.source: Enables or disables the voice dialing feature on the device.
trans-unit.target: Enables or disables the voice dialing feature on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allows copy and paste functions on the device.
trans-unit.target: Allows copy and paste functions on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allows use of the clipboard to copy and paste between apps.
trans-unit.target: Allows use of the clipboard to copy and paste between apps.

trans-unit.source: Allows the use of YouTube on the device.
trans-unit.target: Allows the use of YouTube on the device.

trans-unit.source: Settings for compliant and noncompliant apps
trans-unit.target: Settings for compliant and noncompliant apps

trans-unit.source: In the **Compliant & Noncompliant Apps** list, specify a list of compliant or noncompliant apps that use the following information:
trans-unit.target: In the **Compliant & Noncompliant Apps** list, specify a list of compliant or noncompliant apps that use the following information:

trans-unit.source: A single policy can contain only a list of compliant apps or a list of noncompliant apps.
trans-unit.target: A single policy can contain only a list of compliant apps or a list of noncompliant apps.

trans-unit.source: You cannot specify both in the same policy.
trans-unit.target: You cannot specify both in the same policy.

trans-unit.source: Report noncompliance when users install the listed apps
trans-unit.target: Report noncompliance when users install the listed apps

trans-unit.source: Lists the apps that are not managed by Intune and which you do not want users to install and run.
trans-unit.target: Lists the apps that are not managed by Intune and which you do not want users to install and run.

trans-unit.source: If users install one of these apps, it will be listed in the noncompliant apps report.
trans-unit.target: If users install one of these apps, it will be listed in the noncompliant apps report.

trans-unit.source: Do not report noncompliance when users install the listed apps
trans-unit.target: Do not report noncompliance when users install the listed apps

trans-unit.source: Lists the apps that you want to allow.
trans-unit.target: Lists the apps that you want to allow.

trans-unit.source: To remain compliant, users must not install any apps that are not listed.
trans-unit.target: To remain compliant, users must not install any apps that are not listed.

trans-unit.source: Apps that are managed by Intune are automatically allowed.
trans-unit.target: Apps that are managed by Intune are automatically allowed.

trans-unit.source: Adds an app to the selected list.
trans-unit.target: Adds an app to the selected list.

trans-unit.source: Specify the name of the app, the app publisher (optional), and the URL of the app in the app store.
trans-unit.target: Specify the name of the app, the app publisher (optional), and the URL of the app in the app store.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Specify URLs to app stores](#specify-urls-to-app-stores) later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Specify URLs to app stores](#specify-urls-to-app-stores) later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Imports a list of apps that you have specified in a comma-separated values file.
trans-unit.target: Imports a list of apps that you have specified in a comma-separated values file.

trans-unit.source: Use the format, application name, publisher, and app URL in the file.
trans-unit.target: Use the format, application name, publisher, and app URL in the file.

trans-unit.source: Lets you edit the name, publisher, and URL of the selected app.
trans-unit.target: Lets you edit the name, publisher, and URL of the selected app.

trans-unit.source: Deletes the selected app from the list.
trans-unit.target: Deletes the selected app from the list.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following settings for **Samsung KNOX devices**:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following settings for **Samsung KNOX devices**:

trans-unit.source: Select a managed app that can run when the device is in kiosk mode
trans-unit.target: Select a managed app that can run when the device is in kiosk mode

trans-unit.source: Choose **Browse**, and then select the managed app that can run when the device is in kiosk mode (apps specified as a link to the store are not currently supported).
trans-unit.target: Choose **Browse**, and then select the managed app that can run when the device is in kiosk mode (apps specified as a link to the store are not currently supported).

trans-unit.source: No other apps will be allowed to run on the device.
trans-unit.target: No other apps will be allowed to run on the device.

trans-unit.source: Enables or disables the use of the volume buttons on the device.
trans-unit.target: Enables or disables the use of the volume buttons on the device.

trans-unit.source: Enables or disables the screen sleep wake button on the device.
trans-unit.target: Enables or disables the screen sleep wake button on the device.

trans-unit.source: Reference information for compliant and noncompliant apps
trans-unit.target: Reference information for compliant and noncompliant apps

trans-unit.source: Use the **Noncompliant Apps Report** to view the compliance of allowed and blocked apps.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Noncompliant Apps Report** to view the compliance of allowed and blocked apps.

trans-unit.source: To run the Noncompliant Apps Report
trans-unit.target: To run the Noncompliant Apps Report

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Reports** > **Noncompliant Apps Report**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Reports** > **Noncompliant Apps Report**.

trans-unit.source: Select the device groups that you want to check.
trans-unit.target: Select the device groups that you want to check.

trans-unit.source: Then choose whether you want to check for compliant apps, noncompliant apps, or both.
trans-unit.target: Then choose whether you want to check for compliant apps, noncompliant apps, or both.

trans-unit.source: To specify an app URL in the compliant and noncompliant apps list, take the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To specify an app URL in the compliant and noncompliant apps list, take the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the [Apps section of Google Play](https://play.google.com/store/apps), search for the app you want to use.
trans-unit.target: In the [Apps section of Google Play](https://play.google.com/store/apps), search for the app you want to use.

trans-unit.source: Open the installation page for the app, and then copy the URL to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Open the installation page for the app, and then copy the URL to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: You can now use this as the URL in either the compliant or noncompliant apps list.
trans-unit.target: You can now use this as the URL in either the compliant or noncompliant apps list.

trans-unit.source: Example: Search Google Play for Microsoft Office Mobile.
trans-unit.target: Example: Search Google Play for Microsoft Office Mobile.

trans-unit.source: The URL you use will be **https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.office.officehub**.
trans-unit.target: The URL you use will be **https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.office.officehub**.

trans-unit.source: Use the Microsoft Intune **Android custom configuration policy** to deploy OMA-URI settings that can be used to control features on Android devices.
trans-unit.target: Use the Microsoft Intune **Android custom configuration policy** to deploy OMA-URI settings that can be used to control features on Android devices.

trans-unit.source: These are standard settings that many mobile device manufacturers use to control device features.
trans-unit.target: These are standard settings that many mobile device manufacturers use to control device features.

trans-unit.source: This capability is intended to allow you to deploy Android settings that are not configurable with Intune policies.
trans-unit.target: This capability is intended to allow you to deploy Android settings that are not configurable with Intune policies.

trans-unit.source: Currently, Android custom policies only support configuring Wi-Fi settings for Android devices that include a pre-shared key.
trans-unit.target: Currently, Android custom policies only support configuring Wi-Fi settings for Android devices that include a pre-shared key.

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the Android custom policy to help you identify it in the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the Android custom policy to help you identify it in the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the Android custom policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
trans-unit.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the Android custom policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the OMA-URI setting to help you identify it in the list of settings.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the OMA-URI setting to help you identify it in the list of settings.

trans-unit.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the setting and other relevant information to help you locate it.
trans-unit.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the setting and other relevant information to help you locate it.

trans-unit.source: Select the data type in which you will specify this OMA-URI setting.
trans-unit.target: Select the data type in which you will specify this OMA-URI setting.

trans-unit.source: Choose from **String, String (XML), Date and time, Integer, Floating point**, or **Boolean**.
trans-unit.target: Choose from **String, String (XML), Date and time, Integer, Floating point**, or **Boolean**.

trans-unit.source: Specify the OMA-URI you want to supply a setting for.
trans-unit.target: Specify the OMA-URI you want to supply a setting for.

trans-unit.source: Specify the value to associate with the OMA-URI that you specified previously.
trans-unit.target: Specify the value to associate with the OMA-URI that you specified previously.

trans-unit.source: Create a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key
trans-unit.target: Create a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key

trans-unit.source: Use a custom policy to create a per-app VPN profile for Android devices
trans-unit.target: Use a custom policy to create a per-app VPN profile for Android devices

trans-unit.source: Use custom policies to allow and block apps for Samsung KNOX devices
trans-unit.target: Use custom policies to allow and block apps for Samsung KNOX devices

trans-unit.source: Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies
trans-unit.target: Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies
